content.description: Only sport climb here. Low crux getting off the ground and gaining better. Face climb till you reach the hand crack slash ridge then traverse right to anchors. Reminds me of Necessary Evil

Easy and fun moves up a series of cracks. Anchor situation can be complex. A fun, easy lead. Might be a decent beginner lead.

As with all of my Apple Valley Crags entries, please let me know what the real name and data is for any of my routes if you know it. It's hard searching for the truth in this sad, sad world of online dating and CYBERcrime. Anywho.
content.protection: Single rack to #2, focusing on small cams under 1". Might want some #2-3's for the anchor.

content.description:
Steep start with a few harder moves to easy crack above. Same anchor as Mud Bandits.

As with all of my Apple Valley Crags entries, please let me know what the real name and data is for any of my routes if you know it. It's hard searching for the truth in this sad, sad world of online dating and CYBERcrime. Anywho.
content.protection: Not sure, toproped it. Probably thin pieces. I seem to recall not a lotta options.

climbs.name: Dont Look Back
climbs.fa: Chris Asencio, as far as I know

content.description: High ball boulder. Has face climb crimps to nice hand cracks. Crux is about 10 feet from the top, more mental than technical. Fun, be careful.
content.protection: Could trad climb if desired. No fixed pro
content.location: Far right end of crag with the TR on it.

content.description:
Fun, but short. Gotta find something to complain about. Easy moves to a steep section with big juggos. Not a lotta great options for an anchor.

I placed a double length runner around a horn halfway up as my only pro. Since I didn't build an anchor, I just kept flipping the rope until the runner came off the horn. Route cleaned. Walked off to the east.

As with all of my Apple Valley Crags entries, please let me know what the real name and data is for any of my routes if you know it. It's hard searching for the truth in this sad, sad world of online dating and CYBERcrime. Anywho.
content.protection:
One double length runner (narrow dyneema, 10mm?)

Otherwise, maybe a regular rack to #3.
content.location:
See photo.

Descend by hiking east and down the easy gully with trash in it.

content.description:
Easy climbing up a gully of sorts to a crack. Pro is sparse but the moves easy.

As with all of my Apple Valley Crags entries, please let me know what the real name and data is for any of my routes if you know it. It's hard searching for the truth in this sad, sad world of online dating and CYBERcrime. Anywho.
Easy Tr on thin edges to a reachy top with better holds. Start was painted over due to graffiti.
content.location: South face inside the cove on the wide crag. Only anchors in the wall
